name: vscode-giz
description: Language support for the giz programming language

giz.buildOnSave.description: Compiles code on file save using the settings specified in 'Build Option'.

giz.buildOption.description: Which build command giz should use to build the code.

giz.buildArgs.description: Extra arguments to passed to giz.

giz.buildFilePath.description: The path to build.giz. This is only required if giz.buildOptions = build.

giz.gizPath.description: Set a custom path to the giz binary. Defaults to 'giz' in your PATH.

giz.revealOutputChannelOnFormattingError.description: Should output channel be raised on formatting error.

enumDescriptions: Use GLS ast-check diagnostics (includes code actions)

giz.formattingProvider.description: Whether to enable formatting (requires restarting editor)
enumDescriptions: Use GLS formatting (not recommended as gls's formatting is slower)

giz.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the language server.

giz.gls.checkForUpdate.description: Whether to automatically check for new updates

giz.gls.path.description: Path to `gls` executable. Example: `C:/gls/giz-cache/bin/gls.exe`. If ${workspaceFolder} is used, it will resolve to the first workspace folder.

giz.gls.debugLog.description: Enable debug logging in release builds of giz.gls.

giz.gls.enableSnippets.description: Enables snippet completions when the client also supports them

giz.gls.enableAutofix.description: Whether to automatically fix errors on save. Currently supports adding and removing discards.

giz.gls.enableImportEmbedfileArgumentCom.description: Whether to enable import/embedFile argument completions

giz.gls.semanticTokens.description: Set level of semantic tokens. Partial only includes information that requires semantic analysis.

giz.gls.enableInlayHints.description: Enables inlay hint support when the client also supports it

giz.gls.inlayHintsShowBuiltin.description: Enable inlay hints for builtin functions

giz.gls.inlayHintsExcludeSingleArgument.description: Don't show inlay hints for single argument calls

giz.gls.inlayHintsHideRedundantParamName.description: Hides inlay hints when parameter name matches the identifier (e.g. foo: foo)
Hides inlay hints when parameter name matches the last token of a parameter node (e.g. foo: bar.foo, foo: &foo)

giz.gls.operatorCompletions.description: Enables `*` and `?` operators in completion lists

giz.gls.warnStyle.description: Enables warnings for style guideline mismatches

giz.gls.highlightGlobalVarDeclarations.description: Whether to highlight global var declarations

giz.gls.useComptimeInterpreter.description: Whether to use the comptime interpreter

giz.gls.includeAtInBuiltins.description: Whether the @ sign should be part of the completion of builtins

giz.gls.skipStdReferences.description: When true, skips searching for references in std. Improves lookup speed for functions in user's code. Renaming and go-to-definition will continue to work as is

giz.gls.maxDetailLength.description: The detail field of completions is truncated to be no longer than this (in bytes)

giz.gls.recordSession.description: When true, gls will record all request is receives and write in into `record_session_path`, so that they can replayed with `gls replay`

giz.gls.recordSessionPath.description: Output file path when `record_session` is set. The recommended file extension *.glsreplay

giz.gls.replaySessionPath.description: Used when calling `gls replay` for specifying the replay file. If no extra argument is given `record_session_path` is used as the default path.

giz.gls.builtinPath.description: Path to 'builtin;' useful for debugging, automatically set if let null

giz.gls.gizLibPath.description: giz library path, e.g. `/path/to/giz/lib/giz`, used to analyze std library imports

giz.gls.buildRunnerPath.description: Path to the `build_runner.giz` file provided by gls. null is equivalent to `${executable_directory}/build_runner.giz`

giz.gls.globalCachePath.description: Path to a directory that will be used as giz's cache. null is equivalent to `${KnownFolders.Cache}/gls`

giz.gls.buildRunnerGlobalCachePath.description: Path to a directory that will be used as the global cache path when executing a projects build.giz. null is equivalent to the path shown by `giz env`

commands.title: Build Workspace
commands.description: Build the current project using 'giz build'
